	<item>
		<title>The Crane goes beyond the typical Caribbean vacation packages, and offers unparalleled luxury</title>
		<link>http://localhost/whb/?attachment_id=660</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 10 Jan 2013 11:10:40 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>themefuse</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2013/01/01.jpg</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>On the DR's still sleepy Samana Peninsula, this all-suite retreat opened in March 2012.</title>

		<title>Suite's condo-style set up means there's room for lounging in the spacious living areas.</title>
		<link>http://localhost/whb/?attachment_id=920</link>

		<title>Suite's condo-style set up means there's room for lounging in the spacious living areas.</title>
		<link>http://localhost/whb/?attachment_id=938</link>

		<title>Suite's condo-style set up means there's room for lounging in the spacious living areas.</title>

	<item>
		<title>Suite's condo-style set up means there's room for lounging in the spacious living areas.</title>
		<link>http://localhost/whb/?attachment_id=984</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 11 Jan 2013 17:33:14 +0000</pubDate>

		<title>Suite's condo-style set up means there's room for lounging in the spacious living areas.</title>
		<link>http://localhost/whb/?attachment_id=1018</link>

		<title>Suite's condo-style set up means there's room for lounging in the spacious living areas.</title>
		<link>http://localhost/whb/?attachment_id=1035</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 11 Jan 2013 18:54:27 +0000</pubDate>

	<item>
		<title>Suite's condo-style set up means there's room for lounging in the spacious living areas.</title>
		<link>http://localhost/whb/?attachment_id=1069</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 11 Jan 2013 19:20:16 +0000</pubDate>

	<item>
		<title>Suite's condo-style set up means there's room for lounging in the spacious living areas.</title>
		<link>http://localhost/whb/?attachment_id=1086</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 11 Jan 2013 19:31:51 +0000</pubDate>

	<item>
		<title>Thanks to its seaside location on the famed Crane Beach, the secluded resort has a romantic vibe.</title>

		<title>Thanks to its seaside location on the famed Crane Beach, the secluded resort has a romantic vibe.</title>
		<link>http://localhost/whb/?attachment_id=1195</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 29 Apr 2013 09:26:54 +0000</pubDate>

		<title>Thanks to its seaside location on the famed Crane Beach, the secluded resort has a romantic vibe.</title>
		<link>http://localhost/whb/?attachment_id=1212</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 29 Apr 2013 10:01:17 +0000</pubDate>

		<title>Thanks to its seaside location on the famed Crane Beach, the secluded resort has a romantic vibe.</title>
		<link>http://localhost/whb/?attachment_id=1229</link>

	<item>
		<title>Thanks to its seaside location on the famed Crane Beach, the secluded resort has a romantic vibe.</title>
		<link>http://localhost/whb/?attachment_id=1246</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 01 May 2013 09:34:20 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>themefuse</dc:creator>

	<item>
		<title>Thanks to its seaside location on the famed Crane Beach, the secluded resort has a romantic vibe.</title>
		<link>http://localhost/whb/?attachment_id=1264</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 01 May 2013 09:58:30 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>themefuse</dc:creator>

	<item>
		<title>Thanks to its seaside location on the famed Crane Beach, the secluded resort has a romantic vibe.</title>
		<link>http://localhost/whb/?attachment_id=1282</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 01 May 2013 10:12:57 +0000</pubDate>

	<item>
		<title>02</title>
		<link>http://localhost/whb/?attachment_id=1299</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 01 May 2013 10:30:26 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>themefuse</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2013/01/02.jpg</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>1299</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2013-05-01 10:30:26</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2013-05-01 10:30:26</wp:post_date_gmt>

		<title>The two on-site restaurants include a beach grill for lunch and the Bistro for fresh seafood.</title>
		<link>http://localhost/whb/?attachment_id=1619</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 22 May 2013 05:51:49 +0000</pubDate>

		<title>The two on-site restaurants include a beach grill for lunch and the Bistro for fresh seafood.</title>
		<link>http://localhost/whb/?attachment_id=1636</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 22 May 2013 06:01:28 +0000</pubDate>

		<title>The two on-site restaurants include a beach grill for lunch and the Bistro for fresh seafood.</title>

		<title>The two on-site restaurants include a beach grill for lunch and the Bistro for fresh seafood.</title>
		<link>http://localhost/whb/?attachment_id=1720</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 22 May 2013 07:17:19 +0000</pubDate>

		<title>The two on-site restaurants include a beach grill for lunch and the Bistro for fresh seafood.</title>

		<pubDate>Wed, 22 May 2013 07:34:35 +0000</pubDate>

		<title>The two on-site restaurants include a beach grill for lunch and the Bistro for fresh seafood.</title>

                            &lt;h2&gt;Hotel Overview:&lt;/h2&gt;
                            
                            &lt;div class=&quot;title2&quot;&gt;
                            	&lt;h3&gt;&lt;span&gt;One-Bedroom Garden Deluxe Park&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/h3&gt;
                            &lt;/div&gt;
                            
                            &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;ROOM DETAILS:&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
                            
                            	&lt;div class=&quot;list_check list_details&quot;&gt;       
                                    &lt;ul&gt;
                                    	&lt;li&gt;&lt;strong&gt;One-Bedroom Garden Deluxe Park&lt;/strong&gt; rooms are 1,200 square feet and feature a mater bedroom, an en suite bathroom with a Jacuzzi tub and separate shower, a fully equipped kitchen (refrigerator, ice dispenser, stove and oven, utensils for four, microwave and dishwasher), a seating area with a sofabed and a large patrio with garden views.&lt;/li&gt;                                        
                                        &lt;li&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Maximum Occupancy&lt;/strong&gt;: Four (Rates quoted are for two people. There is a cost to add additional children or adults to this room; see policies below.)&lt;/li&gt;
                                        &lt;li&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Bed Type&lt;/strong&gt;: One King plus one sofabed&lt;/li&gt;
                                        &lt;li&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Children Policy&lt;/strong&gt;: Children two and under are permitted within maximum occupancy at no additional cost using existing bedding. Up to two children three to 12 are permitted in addition to the double occupancy for $40 per child, per night, using existing bedding or a roll-away bed (for an additional cost).&lt;/li&gt;
                                        &lt;li&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Additional Adult Policy&lt;/strong&gt;: Up to two adults 13 and over are prmitted in addition to the double occupancy for $40 per adult, per night, using existing bedding or a roll-away bed (for an additional cost).Roll-away beds are based on availability and cannot be guaranteed; they can be requested for $5 per bed, per night.&lt;/li&gt;                                        
                                        &lt;li&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Additional Person&lt;/strong&gt;: and bedding fees will be collected by the property. For additional person and bedding requests, please highlight in the Special Instructions field after purchase.&lt;/li&gt;
                                        &lt;li&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Handicap-Accessible&lt;/strong&gt;: No, the resort is not accesible by wheel chair.&lt;/li&gt;
                                    &lt;/ul&gt;
                               &lt;/div&gt;
[/raw]";}i:2;a:2:{s:9:"tab_title";s:15:"Maps &amp; Area";s:11:"tab_content";s:1912:"[raw]&lt;h2&gt;MAPS &amp; AREA&lt;/h2&gt;
                            
                            &lt;div class=&quot;title2&quot;&gt;
                            	&lt;h3&gt;Map view for  &lt;span&gt;The Crane, St Philip - Barbados&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/h3&gt;
                                &lt;span class=&quot;title_right&quot;&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;#&quot;&gt;  OPEN FULL MAP&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/span&gt;
                            &lt;/div&gt;	   
                            
                           &lt;p&gt;[map width=&quot;620&quot; height=&quot;420&quot; position=&quot;13.173765506730218:-59.55242156982422&quot; zoom=&quot;12&quot; type=&quot;map1&quot; address=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;]&lt;/p&gt;
                           
                          &lt;p&gt; Class aptent taciti sociosqu ad litora torquent per conubia nostra, per inceptos himenaeos. Sed molestie augue sit amet leo consequat posuere. Vestibulum ante ipsum primis in faucibus orci luctus et ultrices posuere cubilia Curae; 
                          Proin vel ante a orci tempus eleifend ut et magna. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Vivamus luctus dolor sit amet deritium.&lt;/p&gt;

						  &lt;p&gt;Donec congue lacinia dui, a porttitor lectus condimentum laoreet. Nunc eu ullamcorper orci. Quisque eget odio ac lectus vestibulum faucibus eget in metus. In pellentesque faucibus vestibulum. Nulla at nulla justo, eget luctus tortor. Nulla facilisi. Duis aliquet egestas purus in blandit. Curabitur vulputate, ligula lacinia scelerisque tempor, lacus lacus ornare ante, ac egestas est urna sit amet arcu. &lt;/p&gt;
						  
						  &lt;p&gt;Class aptent taciti sociosqu ad litora torquent per conubia nostra, per inceptos himenaeos. Sed molestie augue sit amet leo consequat posuere. Vestibulum ante ipsum primis in faucibus orci luctus et ultrices posuere cubilia Curae; Proin vel ante.&lt;/p&gt;[/raw]";}i:3;a:2:{s:9:"tab_title";s:12:"Not Included";s:11:"tab_content";s:1941:"[raw]&lt;h2&gt;Hotel Overview:&lt;/h2&gt;
                            
                            &lt;div class=&quot;title2&quot;&gt;
                            	&lt;h3&gt;&lt;span&gt;List of Not Included items for your package:&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/h3&gt;
                            &lt;/div&gt;
                            
                            
                            	[delete_list class=&quot;list_details&quot;]&lt;ul&gt;
                                    	
                                        &lt;li&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Bed Type&lt;/strong&gt;: One King plus one sofabed&lt;/li&gt;
                                        &lt;li&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Children Policy&lt;/strong&gt;: Children two and under are permitted within maximum occupancy at no additional cost using existing bedding. Up to two children three to 12 are permitted in addition to the double occupancy for $40 per child, per night, using existing bedding or a roll-away bed (for an additional cost).&lt;/li&gt;
                                        &lt;li&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Additional Adult Policy&lt;/strong&gt;: Up to two adults 13 and over are prmitted in addition to the double occupancy for $40 per adult, per night, using existing bedding or a roll-away bed (for an additional cost).Roll-away beds are based on availability and cannot be guaranteed; they can be requested for $5 per bed, per night.&lt;/li&gt;                                        
                                        &lt;li&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Additional Person&lt;/strong&gt;: and bedding fees will be collected by the property. For additional person and bedding requests, please highlight in the Special Instructions field after purchase.&lt;/li&gt;
                                        &lt;li&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Handicap-Accessible&lt;/strong&gt;: No, the resort is not accesible by wheel chair.&lt;/li&gt;
                                    &lt;/ul&gt;[/delete_list][/raw]";}}s:16:"voyage_seo_title";s:0:"";s:22:"voyage_seo_description";s:0:"";}]]></wp:meta_value>

                                    	&lt;li&gt;&lt;strong&gt;One-Bedroom Garden Deluxe Park&lt;/strong&gt; rooms are 1,200 square feet and feature a mater bedroom, an en suite bathroom with a Jacuzzi tub and separate shower, a fully equipped kitchen (refrigerator, ice dispenser, stove and oven, utensils for four, microwave and dishwasher), a seating area with a sofabed and a large patrio with garden views.&lt;/li&gt;                                        
                                        &lt;li&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Maximum Occupancy&lt;/strong&gt;: Four (Rates quoted are for two people. There is a cost to add additional children or adults to this room; see policies below.)&lt;/li&gt;

		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Ut in nulla enim. Phasellus molestie magna non est bibendum non venenatis nisl tempor. Suspendisse dictum feugiat nisl ut dapibus. Mauris iaculis porttitor posuere. Praesent id metus massa, ut blandit odio. Proin quis tortor orci. Etiam at risus et justo dignissim congue.

                            	<div class="list_check list_details">       
                                    <ul>
                                    	<li><strong>One-Bedroom Garden Deluxe Park</strong> rooms are 1,200 square feet and feature a mater bedroom, an en suite bathroom with a Jacuzzi tub and separate shower, a fully equipped kitchen (refrigerator, ice dispenser, stove and oven, utensils for four, microwave and dishwasher), a seating area with a sofabed and a large patrio with garden views.</li>

                                        <li><strong>Bed Type</strong>: One King plus one sofabed</li>
                                        <li><strong>Children Policy</strong>: Children two and under are permitted within maximum occupancy at no additional cost using existing bedding. Up to two children three to 12 are permitted in addition to the double occupancy for $40 per child, per night, using existing bedding or a roll-away bed (for an additional cost).</li>
                                        <li><strong>Additional Adult Policy</strong>: Up to two adults 13 and over are prmitted in addition to the double occupancy for $40 per adult, per night, using existing bedding or a roll-away bed (for an additional cost).Roll-away beds are based on availability and cannot be guaranteed; they can be requested for $5 per bed, per night.</li>                                        
                                        <li><strong>Additional Person</strong>: and bedding fees will be collected by the property. For additional person and bedding requests, please highlight in the Special Instructions field after purchase.</li>

Up to two children three to 12 are permitted in addition to the double occupancy for $40 per child, per night, using existing bedding or a roll-away bed (for an additional cost).&lt;/li&gt;
                                        &lt;li&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Additional Adult Policy&lt;/strong&gt;: Up to two adults 13 and over are prmitted in addition to the double occupancy for $40 per adult, per night, using existing bedding or a roll-away bed (for an additional cost).Roll-away beds are based on availability and cannot be guaranteed; they can be requested for $5 per bed, per night.&lt;/li&gt;

                          &lt;p&gt; Class aptent taciti sociosqu ad litora torquent per conubia nostra, per inceptos himenaeos. Sed molestie augue sit amet leo consequat posuere. Vestibulum ante ipsum primis in faucibus orci luctus et ultrices posuere cubilia Curae; 
                          Proin vel ante a orci tempus eleifend ut et magna. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Vivamus luctus dolor sit amet deritium.&lt;/p&gt;

						  &lt;p&gt;Donec congue lacinia dui, a porttitor lectus condimentum laoreet. Nunc eu ullamcorper orci. Quisque eget odio ac lectus vestibulum faucibus eget in metus. In pellentesque faucibus vestibulum. Nulla at nulla justo, eget luctus tortor. Nulla facilisi. Duis aliquet egestas purus in blandit. Curabitur vulputate, ligula lacinia scelerisque tempor, lacus lacus ornare ante, ac egestas est urna sit amet arcu. &lt;/p&gt;
						  
						  &lt;p&gt;Class aptent taciti sociosqu ad litora torquent per conubia nostra, per inceptos himenaeos. Sed molestie augue sit amet leo consequat posuere.                             &lt;div class=&quot;title2&quot;&gt;
                            	&lt;h3&gt;&lt;span&gt;List of Not Included items for your package:&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/h3&gt;
                            &lt;/div&gt;
                            
                            
                            	[delete_list class=&quot;list_details&quot;]&lt;ul&gt;
                                    	
                                        &lt;li&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Bed Type&lt;/strong&gt;: One King plus one sofabed&lt;/li&gt;
                                        &lt;li&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Children Policy&lt;/strong&gt;: Children two and under are permitted within maximum occupancy at no additional cost using existing bedding. Up to two children three to 12 are permitted in addition to the double occupancy for $40 per child, per night, using existing bedding or a roll-away bed (for an additional cost).&lt;/li&gt;
                                        &lt;li&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Additional Adult Policy&lt;/strong&gt;: Up to two adults 13 and over are prmitted in addition to the double occupancy for $40 per adult, per night, using existing bedding or a roll-away bed (for an additional cost).Roll-away beds are based on availability and cannot be guaranteed; they can be requested for $5 per bed, per night.&lt;/li&gt;                                        
                                        &lt;li&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Additional Person&lt;/strong&gt;: and bedding fees will be collected by the property. For additional person and bedding requests, please highlight in the Special Instructions field after purchase.&lt;/li&gt;
                                        &lt;li&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Handicap-Accessible&lt;/strong&gt;: No, the resort is not accesible by wheel chair.&lt;/li&gt;

                            &lt;h2&gt;Hotel Overview:&lt;/h2&gt;
                            
                            &lt;div class=&quot;title2&quot;&gt;
                            	&lt;h3&gt;&lt;span&gt;One-Bedroom Garden Deluxe Park&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/h3&gt;
                            &lt;/div&gt;
                            
                            &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;ROOM DETAILS:&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
                            
                            	&lt;div class=&quot;list_check list_details&quot;&gt;       
                                    &lt;ul&gt;
                                    	&lt;li&gt;&lt;strong&gt;One-Bedroom Garden Deluxe Park&lt;/strong&gt; rooms are 1,200 square feet and feature a mater bedroom, an en suite bathroom with a Jacuzzi tub and separate shower, a fully equipped kitchen (refrigerator, ice dispenser, stove and oven, utensils for four, microwave and dishwasher), a seating area with a sofabed and a large patrio with garden views.&lt;/li&gt;                                        
                                        &lt;li&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Maximum Occupancy&lt;/strong&gt;: Four (Rates quoted are for two people. There is a cost to add additional children or adults to this room; see policies below.)&lt;/li&gt;
                                        &lt;li&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Bed Type&lt;/strong&gt;: One King plus one sofabed&lt;/li&gt;
                                        &lt;li&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Children Policy&lt;/strong&gt;: Children two and under are permitted within maximum occupancy at no additional cost using existing bedding. Up to two children three to 12 are permitted in addition to the double occupancy for $40 per child, per night, using existing bedding or a roll-away bed (for an additional cost).&lt;/li&gt;
                                        &lt;li&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Additional Adult Policy&lt;/strong&gt;: Up to two adults 13 and over are prmitted in addition to the double occupancy for $40 per adult, per night, using existing bedding or a roll-away bed (for an additional cost).Roll-away beds are based on availability and cannot be guaranteed; they can be requested for $5 per bed, per night.&lt;/li&gt;                                        
                                        &lt;li&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Additional Person&lt;/strong&gt;: and bedding fees will be collected by the property. For additional person and bedding requests, please highlight in the Special Instructions field after purchase.&lt;/li&gt;
                                        &lt;li&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Handicap-Accessible&lt;/strong&gt;: No, the resort is not accesible by wheel chair.&lt;/li&gt;
                                    &lt;/ul&gt;

		<title>City Tour, Buenos Aires</title>

		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Sleep in Argentine style at this Art Deco gem of a boutique hotel, conveniently located near the citys major landmarks. With vintage tiles, modern lofts, and a rooftop Jacuzzi, youll be living like a millionaire for pennies on the dollar.]]></content:encoded>

			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[a:20:{s:22:"voyage_thumbnail_image";s:64:"http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2013/01/BuenosAires2.jpg";s:23:"seek_property_sale_type";s:1:"1";s:13:"voyage_during";s:1:"7";s:22:"seek_property_includes";s:1:"3";s:31:"seek_property_availability_from";s:21:"2013-03-06/2013-07-24";s:29:"seek_property_availability_to";s:0:"";s:15:"voyage_is_promo";s:5:"false";s:23:"seek_property_reduction";s:1:"0";s:19:"seek_property_price";s:3:"299";s:23:"voyage_disable_comments";s:4:"true";s:17:"voyage_page_title";s:13:"default_title";s:19:"voyage_custom_title";s:0:"";s:21:"voyage_header_element";s:4:"none";s:20:"voyage_select_slider";s:2:"-1";s:29:"voyage_before_content_element";s:6:"search";s:18:"voyage_search_type";s:6:"closed";s:28:"voyage_after_content_element";s:16:"similar_holidays";s:25:"voyage_content_tabs_table";a:4:{i:0;a:2:{s:9:"tab_title";s:8:"Overview";s:11:"tab_content";s:6784:"[raw]&lt;h2&gt;Package Includes:&lt;/h2&gt;
                            
                            &lt;div class=&quot;title2&quot;&gt;
                            	&lt;h3&gt;7 nights, Breakfast included at &lt;span&gt;The Crane Residential Resort&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/h3&gt;
                                &lt;span class=&quot;title_right&quot;&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;#&quot;&gt;  more details&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/span&gt;
                            &lt;/div&gt;
                            
                            &lt;div class=&quot;row&quot;&gt;
	                            &lt;div class=&quot;col col_1_2&quot;&gt;
								&lt;p&gt;This elegant beachfront retreat offers modern facilities and high quality accommodation. Set on a private beach in Sharks Bay overlooking Tiran Island, it&#039;s a wonderful place to bask in the sunshine or experience the snorkelling and scuba-diving for which Sharm is renowned around the world. &lt;/p&gt;
	                            &lt;/div&gt;
                                
                                &lt;div class=&quot;col col_1_2&quot;&gt;
									&lt;div class=&quot;list_check bolded&quot;&gt;       
                                    &lt;ul&gt;
                                    	&lt;li&gt;3 Separate Swimming Pools&lt;/li&gt;                                        
                                        &lt;li&gt;High-speed Internet access&lt;/li&gt;
                                        &lt;li&gt;Multiple 5 star restaurants in the resort &lt;/li&gt;
                                        &lt;li&gt;Separate bathtub and shower&lt;/li&gt;
                                        &lt;li&gt;Shopping center shuttle (complimentary)&lt;/li&gt;                                        
                                    &lt;/ul&gt;
                                 	&lt;/div&gt;
	                            &lt;/div&gt;

                            &lt;div class=&quot;title2&quot;&gt;
                            	&lt;h3&gt;&lt;span&gt;One-Bedroom Garden Deluxe Park&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/h3&gt;
                            &lt;/div&gt;
                            
                            &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;ROOM DETAILS:&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
                            
                            	&lt;div class=&quot;list_check list_details&quot;&gt;       
                                    &lt;ul&gt;
                                    	&lt;li&gt;&lt;strong&gt;One-Bedroom Garden Deluxe Park&lt;/strong&gt; rooms are 1,200 square feet and feature a mater bedroom, an en suite bathroom with a Jacuzzi tub and separate shower, a fully equipped kitchen (refrigerator, ice dispenser, stove and oven, utensils for four, microwave and dishwasher), a seating area with a sofabed and a large patrio with garden views.&lt;/li&gt;                                        
                                        &lt;li&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Maximum Occupancy&lt;/strong&gt;: Four (Rates quoted are for two people. There is a cost to add additional children or adults to this room; see policies below.)&lt;/li&gt;
                                        &lt;li&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Bed Type&lt;/strong&gt;: One King plus one sofabed&lt;/li&gt;
                                        &lt;li&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Children Policy&lt;/strong&gt;: Children two and under are permitted within maximum occupancy at no additional cost using existing bedding. Up to two children three to 12 are permitted in addition to the double occupancy for $40 per child, per night, using existing bedding or a roll-away bed (for an additional cost).&lt;/li&gt;
                                        &lt;li&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Additional Adult Policy&lt;/strong&gt;: Up to two adults 13 and over are prmitted in addition to the double occupancy for $40 per adult, per night, using existing bedding or a roll-away bed (for an additional cost).Roll-away beds are based on availability and cannot be guaranteed; they can be requested for $5 per bed, per night.&lt;/li&gt;                                        
                                        &lt;li&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Additional Person&lt;/strong&gt;: and bedding fees will be collected by the property. For additional person and bedding requests, please highlight in the Special Instructions field after purchase.&lt;/li&gt;
                                        &lt;li&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Handicap-Accessible&lt;/strong&gt;: No, the resort is not accesible by wheel chair.&lt;/li&gt;
                                    &lt;/ul&gt;

                            <h2>Hotel Overview:</h2>
                            
                            <div class="title2">
                            	<h3><span>One-Bedroom Garden Deluxe Park</span></h3>
                            </div>
                            
                            <p><strong>ROOM DETAILS:</strong></p>
                            
                            	<div class="list_check list_details">       
                                    <ul>
                                    	<li><strong>One-Bedroom Garden Deluxe Park</strong> rooms are 1,200 square feet and feature a mater bedroom, an en suite bathroom with a Jacuzzi tub and separate shower, a fully equipped kitchen (refrigerator, ice dispenser, stove and oven, utensils for four, microwave and dishwasher), a seating area with a sofabed and a large patrio with garden views.</li>                                        
                                        <li><strong>Maximum Occupancy</strong>: Four (Rates quoted are for two people. There is a cost to add additional children or adults to this room; see policies below.)</li>
                                        <li><strong>Bed Type</strong>: One King plus one sofabed</li>
                                        <li><strong>Children Policy</strong>: Children two and under are permitted within maximum occupancy at no additional cost using existing bedding. Up to two children three to 12 are permitted in addition to the double occupancy for $40 per child, per night, using existing bedding or a roll-away bed (for an additional cost).</li>
                                        <li><strong>Additional Adult Policy</strong>: Up to two adults 13 and over are prmitted in addition to the double occupancy for $40 per adult, per night, using existing bedding or a roll-away bed (for an additional cost).Roll-away beds are based on availability and cannot be guaranteed; they can be requested for $5 per bed, per night.</li>                                        
                                        <li><strong>Additional Person</strong>: and bedding fees will be collected by the property. For additional person and bedding requests, please highlight in the Special Instructions field after purchase.</li>
                                        <li><strong>Handicap-Accessible</strong>: No, the resort is not accesible by wheel chair.</li>
                                    </ul>

                            	<div class="list_check list_details">       
                                    <ul>
                                    	<li><strong>One-Bedroom Garden Deluxe Park</strong> rooms are 1,200 square feet and feature a mater bedroom, an en suite bathroom with a Jacuzzi tub and separate shower, a fully equipped kitchen (refrigerator, ice dispenser, stove and oven, utensils for four, microwave and dishwasher), a seating area with a sofabed and a large patrio with garden views.</li>                                        
                                        <li><strong>Maximum Occupancy</strong>: Four (Rates quoted are for two people. There is a cost to add additional children or adults to this room; see policies below.)</li>
                                        <li><strong>Bed Type</strong>: One King plus one sofabed</li>
                                        <li><strong>Children Policy</strong>: Children two and under are permitted within maximum occupancy at no additional cost using existing bedding. Up to two children three to 12 are permitted in addition to the double occupancy for $40 per child, per night, using existing bedding or a roll-away bed (for an additional cost).</li>

                            <div class="title2">

                            	<div class="list_check list_details">       
                                    <ul>
                                    	<li><strong>One-Bedroom Garden Deluxe Park</strong> rooms are 1,200 square feet and feature a mater bedroom, an en suite bathroom with a Jacuzzi tub and separate shower, a fully equipped kitchen (refrigerator, ice dispenser, stove and oven, utensils for four, microwave and dishwasher), a seating area with a sofabed and a large patrio with garden views.</li>                                        
                                        <li><strong>Maximum Occupancy</strong>: Four (Rates quoted are for two people. There is a cost to add additional children or adults to this room; see policies below.)</li>
                                        <li><strong>Bed Type</strong>: One King plus one sofabed</li>
                                        <li><strong>Children Policy</strong>: Children two and under are permitted within maximum occupancy at no additional cost using existing bedding. Up to two children three to 12 are permitted in addition to the double occupancy for $40 per child, per night, using existing bedding or a roll-away bed (for an additional cost).</li>

                                    <ul>
                                    	<li><strong>One-Bedroom Garden Deluxe Park</strong> rooms are 1,200 square feet and feature a mater bedroom, an en suite bathroom with a Jacuzzi tub and separate shower, a fully equipped kitchen (refrigerator, ice dispenser, stove and oven, utensils for four, microwave and dishwasher), a seating area with a sofabed and a large patrio with garden views.</li>

                                        <li><strong>Bed Type</strong>: One King plus one sofabed</li>
                                        <li><strong>Children Policy</strong>: Children two and under are permitted within maximum occupancy at no additional cost using existing bedding. Up to two children three to 12 are permitted in addition to the double occupancy for $40 per child, per night, using existing bedding or a roll-away bed (for an additional cost).</li>

                                    </ul>

                                        <li><strong>Maximum Occupancy</strong>: Four (Rates quoted are for two people. There is a cost to add additional children or adults to this room; see policies below.)</li>
                                        <li><strong>Bed Type</strong>: One King plus one sofabed</li>
                                        <li><strong>Children Policy</strong>: Children two and under are permitted within maximum occupancy at no additional cost using existing bedding. Up to two children three to 12 are permitted in addition to the double occupancy for $40 per child, per night, using existing bedding or a roll-away bed (for an additional cost).</li>
                                        <li><strong>Additional Adult Policy</strong>: Up to two adults 13 and over are prmitted in addition to the double occupancy for $40 per adult, per night, using existing bedding or a roll-away bed (for an additional cost).Roll-away beds are based on availability and cannot be guaranteed; they can be requested for $5 per bed, per night.</li>                                        
                                        <li><strong>Additional Person</strong>: and bedding fees will be collected by the property. For additional person and bedding requests, please highlight in the Special Instructions field after purchase.</li>
                                        <li><strong>Handicap-Accessible</strong>: No, the resort is not accesible by wheel chair.</li>
                                    </ul>

                                        <li><strong>Additional Person</strong>: and bedding fees will be collected by the property. For additional person and bedding requests, please highlight in the Special Instructions field after purchase.</li>
                                        <li><strong>Handicap-Accessible</strong>: No, the resort is not accesible by wheel chair.</li>

                                    	<li><strong>One-Bedroom Garden Deluxe Park</strong> rooms are 1,200 square feet and feature a mater bedroom, an en suite bathroom with a Jacuzzi tub and separate shower, a fully equipped kitchen (refrigerator, ice dispenser, stove and oven, utensils for four, microwave and dishwasher), a seating area with a sofabed and a large patrio with garden views.</li>                                        
                                        <li><strong>Maximum Occupancy</strong>: Four (Rates quoted are for two people. There is a cost to add additional children or adults to this room; see policies below.)</li>
                                        <li><strong>Bed Type</strong>: One King plus one sofabed</li>
                                        <li><strong>Children Policy</strong>: Children two and under are permitted within maximum occupancy at no additional cost using existing bedding. Up to two children three to 12 are permitted in addition to the double occupancy for $40 per child, per night, using existing bedding or a roll-away bed (for an additional cost).</li>
                                        <li><strong>Additional Adult Policy</strong>: Up to two adults 13 and over are prmitted in addition to the double occupancy for $40 per adult, per night, using existing bedding or a roll-away bed (for an additional cost).Roll-away beds are based on availability and cannot be guaranteed; they can be requested for $5 per bed, per night.</li>

                                    </ul>

                                        <li><strong>Additional Adult Policy</strong>: Up to two adults 13 and over are prmitted in addition to the double occupancy for $40 per adult, per night, using existing bedding or a roll-away bed (for an additional cost).Roll-away beds are based on availability and cannot be guaranteed; they can be requested for $5 per bed, per night.</li>                                        
                                        <li><strong>Additional Person</strong>: and bedding fees will be collected by the property. For additional person and bedding requests, please highlight in the Special Instructions field after purchase.</li>
                                        <li><strong>Handicap-Accessible</strong>: No, the resort is not accesible by wheel chair.</li>
                                    </ul>[/delete_list][/raw]";}}s:16:"voyage_seo_title";s:0:"";s:22:"voyage_seo_description";s:0:"";}]]></wp:meta_value>

                            </div>

                            	<div class="list_check list_details">       
                                    <ul>
                                    	<li><strong>One-Bedroom Garden Deluxe Park</strong> rooms are 1,200 square feet and feature a mater bedroom, an en suite bathroom with a Jacuzzi tub and separate shower, a fully equipped kitchen (refrigerator, ice dispenser, stove and oven, utensils for four, microwave and dishwasher), a seating area with a sofabed and a large patrio with garden views.</li>                                        
                                        <li><strong>Maximum Occupancy</strong>: Four (Rates quoted are for two people. There is a cost to add additional children or adults to this room; see policies below.)</li>
                                        <li><strong>Bed Type</strong>: One King plus one sofabed</li>
                                        <li><strong>Children Policy</strong>: Children two and under are permitted within maximum occupancy at no additional cost using existing bedding. Up to two children three to 12 are permitted in addition to the double occupancy for $40 per child, per night, using existing bedding or a roll-away bed (for an additional cost).</li>

Los Angeles Times- Kobe Bryant has received a reported $6.7-million offer from an Italian team, but it was far from certain Bryant would play there, according to a person familiar with Bryant's thought process. The lucrative offers, most of them real, keep rolling in for Kobe Bryant. He got a contract offer this week from an Italian pro team, though it was far from certain Bryant would play there, according to a person familiar with Bryant's thought process.

		<title>Shortcodes - Buttons &amp; Lists</title>
		<link>http://localhost/whb/?page_id=116</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 27 Sep 2012 14:09:27 +0000</pubDate>

		<content:encoded><![CDATA[[raw]

[button target="_self" size="normal" style="" class="" link="#"]Default Button[/button]  [button target="_self" size="normal" style="" class="btn_blue" link="#"]Light Blue[/button]  [button target="_self" size="normal" style="" class="btn_turquoise" link="#"]Turquoise[/button]

[button target="_self" size="normal" style="" class="btn_green" link="#"]Green[/button]  [button target="_self" size="normal" style="" class="btn_yellow" link="#"]Yellow[/button]  [button target="_self" size="normal" style="" class="btn_orange" link="#"]Orange[/button]

[button target="_self" size="normal" style="" class="btn_red" link="#"]Red[/button]  [button target="_self" size="normal" style="" class="btn_pink" link="#"]Pink[/button]  [button target="_self" size="normal" style="" class="btn_purple" link="#"]Purple[/button]

[code]

		<title>Shortcodes - Charts</title>

[/code]
<h2>Line Chart</h2>
[chart width="575" height="250" type="line" title="Monthly sales growth" data="40,25,5,25,5" legend="40|25|5|25|5" label="Mar.|Apr.|May|Jun.|Jul." colors="FF9900"]
[code]
[chart width="575" height="250" type="line" title="Monthly sales growth" data="40,25,5,25,5" legend="40|25|5|25|5" label="Mar.|Apr.|May|Jun.|Jul." colors="FF9900"]
[/code]

		<title>Shortcodes - Columns</title>

[row]
[col type="1_2"]
<h2>One half column</h2>
Hey there where ya goin, not exactly knowin, who says you have to call just one place home. Hes goin everywhere, B.J. McKay and his best friend Bear. He just keeps on movin, ladies keep improvin, every day is better than the last. New dreams and better scenes, and best of all I dont pay property tax.

[/col]
[col type="1_2"]
<h2>One half column</h2>
Theres a voice that keeps on calling me. Down the road, thats where Ill always be. Every stop I make, I make a new friend. Cant stay for long, just turn around and Im gone again. Maybe tomorrow, Ill want to settle down, Until tomorrow, Ill just keep moving on.

[/col]
[/row]
[clear]
[row]
[col type="1_3"]
<h2>1/3 column</h2>
Sliders in all forms &amp; colors: Javascript, Flash, you name it! We've got it! But the best part is that they can be easily modified to fit your company's look &amp; feel.

[/col]
[col type="1_3"]
<h2>1/3 column</h2>
These three icons below the text paragraphs are custom created for the <a href="#">Our theme</a> &amp; the included PSD files contain all the layers needed to edit them.

[/col]
[col type="1_3"]
<h2>1/3 last</h2>
If you buy this theme we offer 24 hours response time on our dedicated support forums. That's "best in class" support offer, it just can't get better &amp; faster than this!

[/col]

		<title>Shortcodes - Maps</title>
		<link>http://localhost/whb/?page_id=136</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 27 Sep 2012 15:33:35 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>themefuse</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://localhost/travel/?page_id=136</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[[raw]
<h2>Default Maps view</h2>
[map width="590" height="350" position="41.881831:-87.629814" zoom="10" type="map1" address="" title=""]
[code]
[map width="590" height="350" position="41.881831:-87.629814" zoom="10" type="map1" address="" title=""]
[/code]
<h2>Different Maps type : <span>HYBRID</span></h2>
[map width="590" height="350" position="41.881831:-87.629814" zoom="10" type="map2" address="" title=""]
[code]
[map width="590" height="350" position="41.881831:-87.629814" zoom="10" type="map2" address="" title=""]
[/code]
<p>The following types are supported:</p>
                        <ul>
                          <li><strong>ROADMAP</strong> displays the normal, default 2D tiles of Google    Maps.</li>
                          <li><strong>SATELLITE</strong> displays photographic tiles.</li>
                          <li><strong>HYBRID</strong> displays a mix of photographic tiles and a tile layer     for prominent features (roads, city names).</li>
                          <li><strong>TERRAIN</strong> displays physical relief tiles for displaying    elevation and water features (mountains, rivers, etc.).</li>
                        </ul>                       
<h2>Maps with marker and info window</h2>
[map width="590" height="400" position="41.881831:-87.629814" zoom="7" type="map3" address="Chicago, IL, United States" title=""]
[code]
[map width="590" height="400" position="41.881831:-87.629814" zoom="7" type="map3" address="Chicago, IL, United States" title=""]
[/code]
[/raw]]]></content:encoded>

<h2>Toggle Content:</h2>
[toggle_content title="Toggle Content (Click to Open) " class="box"]Every one of our wp themes, comes with extensive documentation and video tutorials that help you install, set up, and edit your theme and you don't even need a lot of wp knowledge or programming skills like js, or php. The thing we are most proud of when we talk about support, it our AfterCare Support Forums that you can access any time and receive guidance and solutions to your issues directly from the ThemeFuse developers[/toggle_content]
[code]
[toggle_content title="Toggle Content (Click to Open) " class="box"]
toogle content here...
[/toggle_content] 
[/code]
<h2>Toggle <span>FAQ</span></h2>
[toggle_content title="Toggle Content (Click to Open) " class="box"][faq title=""][faq_question]What AfterCare services do you offer?[/faq_question][faq_answer]<p>Every one of our wp themes, comes with extensive documentation and video tutorials that help you install, set up, and edit your theme and you don't even need a lot of wp knowledge or programming skills like js, or php. The thing we are most proud of when we talk about support, it our AfterCare Support Forums that you can access any time and receive guidance and solutions to your issues directly from the ThemeFuse developers</p>[/faq_answer][faq_question]How do i get in touch with you?[/faq_question][faq_answer]<p>First of all we recommend you to check the product detail page. We try to make this page as complete as we can, so you'll find there description, features and live demo preview access.</p>                   <p>However, if you still have some questions, you can use the direct contact form from the contact page. Don't forget to select "Pre purchase question" from the list of subjects. </p>[/faq_answer][faq_question]How do I install a fresh copy of WordPress?[/faq_question][faq_answer]This has to be. One for all and all for one, Muskehounds are always ready. One for all and all for one, helping everybody. One for all and all for one, can sound pretty corny.[/faq_answer][/faq]

[/toggle_content]
[/code] 
[/raw]]]></content:encoded>

<h2>Styled Boxes</h2>
[raw]
[styled_box title="Styled box Pink" class="sb_pink"]Insert the content here[/styled_box]
[styled_box title="Styled box Yellow" class="sb_yellow"]Insert the content here[/styled_box]
[styled_box title="Styled box Blue" class="sb_blue"]Insert the content here[/styled_box]
[styled_box title="Styled box Green" class="sb_green"]Insert the content here[/styled_box]
[styled_box title="Styled box Dark" class="sb_dark"]Insert the content here[/styled_box]
[styled_box title="Styled box Purple" class="sb_purple"]Insert the content here[/styled_box]
[styled_box title="Styled box Orange" class="sb_orange"]Insert the content here[/styled_box]
[styled_box title="Styled box Default Color" class=""]Insert the content here[/styled_box]
[/raw]
[raw]
[code]
[styled_box title="Styled box Pink" class="sb_pink"]Insert the content here[/styled_box]
[/code]
[/raw]
<p><strong>[ styled_box ] colors: </strong>gray (default), pink, brown, orange, green, blue, dark_gray, purple</p>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Shortcodes - Typography</title>
		<link>http://localhost/whb/?page_id=145</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 27 Sep 2012 16:11:32 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>themefuse</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://localhost/travel/?page_id=145</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[[raw]
<div class="frame_quote">
[blockquote]<p>Example of emphasisied paragraph: I've gotten burned over Cheryl Tiegs, blown up for Raquel Welch. But when I end up in </p>[/blockquote]
</div>
<p>There's a voice that keeps on calling me. Down the road, that's where I'll always be. Every stop I make, I make a new friend. Can't stay for long, just turn around and I'm gone again. Maybe tomorrow, I'll want to settle down, Until tomorrow, I'll just keep moving on.</p>
<h2>Subtitle of the paragraph (h2)</h2>
              <p>Thunder, thunder, thundercats, Ho! Thundercats are on the move, Thundercats are loose. Feel the magic, hear the roar, Thundercats are loose. Thunder, thunder, thunder, <a href="#">Thundercats</a>! Thunder, thunder, thunder, <strong>Thundercats</strong>! Thunder, thunder, thunder, Thundercats! Thunder, thunder, thunder, Thundercats! Thundercats!</p>
              
              <h3>Example of h3 tag</h3>
              <p>Hey there where ya goin', not exactly knowin', who says you have to call just one place home. He's goin' everywhere, B.J. McKay and his best friend Bear. He just keeps on movin', ladies keep improvin', every day is better than the last. New dreams and better scenes.</p>
[row]
[col type="1_3" rem="false"]<h4>Example of h4 tag</h4>[/col]
[col type="1_3" rem="false"]<h5>Example of h5 tag</h5>[/col]
[col type="1_3" rem="false"]<h6>Example of h6 tag</h6>[/col]
[/row]
[clear]
[divider type="space_thin"]
<h2>Drop Caps & Pull Quotes</h2>
<p>[dropcap1]T[/dropcap1] hunder, thunder, thundercats, Ho! Thundercats are on the move, Thundercats are loose. Feel the magic, hear the roar, Thundercats are loose. Thunder, thunder, thunder, Thundercats! Thunder, Thundercats! Thunder, thunder, thunder, Thundercats! Thunder, thunder, thunder, Thundercats! Thundercats!</p>
              
              <p>Hey there where ya goin', not exactly knowin', who says you have to call just one place home. He's goin' everywhere, B.J. McKay and his best friend Bear. He just keeps on movin', ladies keep improvin', every day is better than the last. New dreams and lorem ipsum better scenes.</p>
              <p><span class="quote_right">80 days around the world, we'll find a pot of gold just sitting  ending white wings of the wind.</span>  Hey there where ya goin', not exactly knowin', who says you have to call just one place home. </p>
              <p>He's goin' everywhere, B.J. McKay and his best friend Bear. He just keeps on movin', onl ladies keep improvin', every day is better than the last. New on dreams and better scenes.</p>
              <p>Hey there where ya goin', not exactly knowin', who says you have to call just one place home. He's goin' everywhere, B.J. McKay and his best friend Bear. He just keeps on movin', ladies keep improvin', every day is better than the last. New dreams and better scenes.</p>
              
              <h2>Text Styles</h2>
              <p><a href="#">Example of link text</a>.<br>
				  <strong>Strong Text eample</strong><br>
				  <em>Example of emphasised text</em> <br>
				  <s>Example of deleted text</s><br>
				  <mark>Example of mark text</mark><br>
                  <ins>Example of ins text</ins><br>     
                  this is <sup>sup</sup> and <sub>sub</sub> text</p>[/raw] ]]></content:encoded>

<h2>Other Shortcodes</h2>

	<item>
		<title>Luxury Style: RITZ-CARLTON Shanghai, Pudong</title>
		<link>http://localhost/whb/?p=191</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 01 Jan 2012 13:53:03 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>themefuse</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://localhost/travel-agency/?p=191</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p><strong>Los Angeles Times</strong>- Kobe Bryant has received a reported $6.7-million offer from an Italian team, but it was far from certain Bryant would play there, according to a person familiar with Bryant's thought process. The lucrative offers, most of them real, keep rolling in for Kobe Bryant. He got a contract offer this week from an Italian pro team, though it was far from certain Bryant would play there, according to a person familiar with Bryant's thought process.</p>
	              <p>The new offer is for a<strong> reported $6.7 million</strong> from Italian team Virtus Bologna, which begins its season Oct. 9 and would have to come up with a huge insurance policy to land Bryant, not to mention the actual cash to get the 13-time all-star to play on the perennially underachieving team.<br>
	              Bryant, 33, is under contract with the Lakers for three more years and $83.5 million. He has several contract options from the Italian team, according to its general manager, including a shorter per-game deal that would work out to<strong> about $740,000 a game</strong>. All options are non-binding, allowing Bryant to return to the Lakers if the NBA lockout ends.</p>
	<p>Even if Bryant doesn't take the offer seriously, he continues to be a man in motion since having a non-invasive procedure on his bothersome right knee in Germany three months ago.</p>
	<p> He made promotional <u><strong>appearances</strong></u> this summer in the Philippines, China and Singapore, scored 43 points in a pro-am game in Los Angeles, played in a celebrity soccer game in Washington, talked briefly with teams in Turkey and China about playing pro basketball there, and was headed to Europe for more paid appearances next week.</p>
	              <p>The league also canceled 43 exhibition games, three of them involving the Lakers: Oct. 9 vs. Golden State in Fresno, Oct. 12 vs. Atlanta in Ontario and Oct. 15 vs. Atlanta at Staples Center.<br>
	                The Lakers were scheduled to open camp Oct. 4, with their annual media day taking place Oct. 3. Both events have been postponed indefinitely because of the lack of progress in NBA labor negotiations.</p>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Travel Quiz: which international city is this?</title>
		<link>http://localhost/whb/?p=208</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 05 Jan 2012 12:12:33 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>themefuse</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://localhost/travel-agency/?p=208</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p><strong>Los Angeles Times</strong>- Kobe Bryant has received a reported $6.7-million offer from an Italian team, but it was far from certain Bryant would play there, according to a person familiar with Bryant's thought process. The lucrative offers, most of them real, keep rolling in for Kobe Bryant. He got a contract offer this week from an Italian pro team, though it was far from certain Bryant would play there, according to a person familiar with Bryant's thought process.</p>
	              <p>The new offer is for a<strong> reported $6.7 million</strong> from Italian team Virtus Bologna, which begins its season Oct. 9 and would have to come up with a huge insurance policy to land Bryant, not to mention the actual cash to get the 13-time all-star to play on the perennially underachieving team.<br>
	              Bryant, 33, is under contract with the Lakers for three more years and $83.5 million. He has several contract options from the Italian team, according to its general manager, including a shorter per-game deal that would work out to<strong> about $740,000 a game</strong>. All options are non-binding, allowing Bryant to return to the Lakers if the NBA lockout ends.</p>
	<p>Even if Bryant doesn't take the offer seriously, he continues to be a man in motion since having a non-invasive procedure on his bothersome right knee in Germany three months ago.</p>
	<p> He made promotional <u><strong>appearances</strong></u> this summer in the Philippines, China and Singapore, scored 43 points in a pro-am game in Los Angeles, played in a celebrity soccer game in Washington, talked briefly with teams in Turkey and China about playing pro basketball there, and was headed to Europe for more paid appearances next week.</p>
	              <p>The league also canceled 43 exhibition games, three of them involving the Lakers: Oct. 9 vs. Golden State in Fresno, Oct. 12 vs. Atlanta in Ontario and Oct. 15 vs. Atlanta at Staples Center.<br>
	                The Lakers were scheduled to open camp Oct. 4, with their annual media day taking place Oct. 3. Both events have been postponed indefinitely because of the lack of progress in NBA labor negotiations.</p>]]></content:encoded>

		<title>Have a great dinner with our Restaurant Giveaway</title>
		<link>http://localhost/whb/?p=214</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 12 Feb 2012 12:28:09 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>themefuse</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://localhost/travel-agency/?p=214</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p><strong>Los Angeles Times</strong>- Kobe Bryant has received a reported $6.7-million offer from an Italian team, but it was far from certain Bryant would play there, according to a person familiar with Bryant's thought process. The lucrative offers, most of them real, keep rolling in for Kobe Bryant. He got a contract offer this week from an Italian pro team, though it was far from certain Bryant would play there, according to a person familiar with Bryant's thought process.</p>
	              <p>The new offer is for a<strong> reported $6.7 million</strong> from Italian team Virtus Bologna, which begins its season Oct. 9 and would have to come up with a huge insurance policy to land Bryant, not to mention the actual cash to get the 13-time all-star to play on the perennially underachieving team.<br>
	              Bryant, 33, is under contract with the Lakers for three more years and $83.5 million. He has several contract options from the Italian team, according to its general manager, including a shorter per-game deal that would work out to<strong> about $740,000 a game</strong>. All options are non-binding, allowing Bryant to return to the Lakers if the NBA lockout ends.</p>
	<p>Even if Bryant doesn't take the offer seriously, he continues to be a man in motion since having a non-invasive procedure on his bothersome right knee in Germany three months ago.</p>
	<p> He made promotional <u><strong>appearances</strong></u> this summer in the Philippines, China and Singapore, scored 43 points in a pro-am game in Los Angeles, played in a celebrity soccer game in Washington, talked briefly with teams in Turkey and China about playing pro basketball there, and was headed to Europe for more paid appearances next week.</p>
	              <p>The league also canceled 43 exhibition games, three of them involving the Lakers: Oct. 9 vs. Golden State in Fresno, Oct. 12 vs. Atlanta in Ontario and Oct. 15 vs. Atlanta at Staples Center.<br>
	                The Lakers were scheduled to open camp Oct. 4, with their annual media day taking place Oct. 3. Both events have been postponed indefinitely because of the lack of progress in NBA labor negotiations.</p>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Chicago SkyTower - 3 day city-break for only $599</title>
		<link>http://localhost/whb/?p=227</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 03 Feb 2012 12:51:36 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>themefuse</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://localhost/travel-agency/?p=224</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p><strong>Los Angeles Times</strong>- Kobe Bryant has received a reported $6.7-million offer from an Italian team, but it was far from certain Bryant would play there, according to a person familiar with Bryant's thought process. The lucrative offers, most of them real, keep rolling in for Kobe Bryant. He got a contract offer this week from an Italian pro team, though it was far from certain Bryant would play there, according to a person familiar with Bryant's thought process.</p>
	              <p>The new offer is for a<strong> reported $6.7 million</strong> from Italian team Virtus Bologna, which begins its season Oct. 9 and would have to come up with a huge insurance policy to land Bryant, not to mention the actual cash to get the 13-time all-star to play on the perennially underachieving team.<br>
	              Bryant, 33, is under contract with the Lakers for three more years and $83.5 million. He has several contract options from the Italian team, according to its general manager, including a shorter per-game deal that would work out to<strong> about $740,000 a game</strong>. All options are non-binding, allowing Bryant to return to the Lakers if the NBA lockout ends.</p>
	<p>Even if Bryant doesn't take the offer seriously, he continues to be a man in motion since having a non-invasive procedure on his bothersome right knee in Germany three months ago.</p>
	<p> He made promotional <u><strong>appearances</strong></u> this summer in the Philippines, China and Singapore, scored 43 points in a pro-am game in Los Angeles, played in a celebrity soccer game in Washington, talked briefly with teams in Turkey and China about playing pro basketball there, and was headed to Europe for more paid appearances next week.</p>
	              <p>The league also canceled 43 exhibition games, three of them involving the Lakers: Oct. 9 vs. Golden State in Fresno, Oct. 12 vs. Atlanta in Ontario and Oct. 15 vs. Atlanta at Staples Center.<br>
	                The Lakers were scheduled to open camp Oct. 4, with their annual media day taking place Oct. 3. Both events have been postponed indefinitely because of the lack of progress in NBA labor negotiations.</p>]]></content:encoded>

			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[a:23:{s:20:"voyage_disable_image";s:5:"false";s:20:"voyage_disable_video";s:5:"false";s:23:"voyage_disable_comments";s:5:"false";s:26:"voyage_disable_author_info";s:5:"false";s:24:"voyage_disable_post_meta";s:5:"false";s:29:"voyage_disable_published_date";s:5:"false";s:28:"voyage_disable_share_buttons";s:5:"false";s:28:"voyage_disable_after_content";s:5:"false";s:19:"voyage_single_image";s:63:"http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2012/10/entry_big_3.jpg";s:28:"voyage_single_img_dimensions";a:2:{i:0;s:3:"620";i:1;s:3:"340";}s:26:"voyage_single_img_position";s:9:"alignleft";s:22:"voyage_thumbnail_image";s:59:"http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2012/10/entry_5.jpg";s:27:"voyage_thumbnail_dimensions";a:2:{i:0;s:3:"219";i:1;s:3:"156";}s:25:"voyage_thumbnail_position";s:9:"alignleft";s:17:"voyage_video_link";s:0:"";s:23:"voyage_video_dimensions";a:2:{i:0;s:3:"620";i:1;s:3:"340";}s:21:"voyage_video_position";s:9:"alignleft";s:21:"voyage_header_element";s:4:"none";s:20:"voyage_select_slider";s:2:"-1";s:29:"voyage_before_content_element";s:6:"search";s:18:"voyage_search_type";s:6:"closed";s:16:"voyage_seo_title";s:0:"";s:22:"voyage_seo_description";s:0:"";}]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key>voyage_post_viewed</wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
	</item>
	<item>
		<title>Shortcodes - Lightbox PrettyPhoto</title>
		<link>http://localhost/whb/?page_id=300</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 04 Oct 2012 12:52:19 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>themefuse</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://localhost/travel-agency/?page_id=300</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[[raw]

<strong>PrettyPhoto</strong> is a jQuery <strong>lightbox clone</strong>. Not only does it support images, it also support for videos, flash, YouTube, iframes and ajax. Its a full blown media lightbox.
<h3>prettyPhoto for Text</h3>
[prettyPhoto title="Title of Image" link="http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2012/10/entry_big_1.jpg" type="link" gallery="" style="" class="" paragraph="true"]Open image with prettyPhoto[/prettyPhoto]
[code]
[prettyPhoto title="Title of Image" link="http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2012/10/entry_big_1.jpg" type="link" gallery="" style="" class="" paragraph="true"]Open image with prettyPhoto[/prettyPhoto]
[/code]
<h3>Button prettyPhoto</h3>
[prettyPhoto title="Button prettyPhoto" link="http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2012/10/entry_big_2.jpg" type="button" gallery="" style="" class="button_link_arrow btn_black_arrow" paragraph="true"]Open image in prettyPhoto[/prettyPhoto]
[code]
[prettyPhoto title="Button prettyPhoto" link="http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2012/10/entry_big_2.jpg" type="button" gallery="" style="" class="button_link_arrow btn_black_arrow" paragraph="true"]Open image in prettyPhoto[/prettyPhoto]
[/code]
<h3>prettyPhoto for elements:</h3>
[prettyPhoto title="Text Title" link="http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2012/10/entry_big_3.jpg" type="link" gallery="" style="" class="" paragraph="true"]<img class="frame_box" src="http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2012/10/atraction_2.jpg" alt="" width="222" height="143" />[/prettyPhoto]

[code]
[prettyPhoto title="Text Title" link="http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2012/10/entry_big_3.jpg" type="link" gallery="" style="" class="" paragraph="true"]<img class="frame_box" src="http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2012/10/atraction_2.jpg" alt="" width="222" height="143" />[/prettyPhoto]
[/code]
<h3>Image Gallery with prettyPhoto</h3>
[prettyPhoto title="Image Gallery prettyPhoto, image 1" link="http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2012/10/entry_big_1.jpg" type="image" gallery="10" style="" class="" paragraph="false"]<img src="http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2012/10/gavatar_1.jpg" alt="" width="56" height="56" />[/prettyPhoto] [prettyPhoto title="Image Gallery prettyPhoto, image 2" link="http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2012/10/entry_big_2.jpg" type="image" gallery="10" style="" class="" paragraph="false"]<img src="http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2012/10/gavatar_2.jpg" alt="" width="56" height="56" />[/prettyPhoto] [prettyPhoto title="Image Gallery prettyPhoto, image 3" link="http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2012/10/entry_big_3.jpg" type="image" gallery="10" style="" class="" paragraph="false"]<img src="http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2012/10/gavatar_3.jpg" alt="" width="56" height="56" />[/prettyPhoto]
[code]
[prettyPhoto title="Image Gallery prettyPhoto, image 1" link="http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2012/10/entry_big_1.jpg" type="image" gallery="10" style="" class="" paragraph="false"]<img src="http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2012/10/gavatar_1.jpg" alt="" width="56" height="56" />[/prettyPhoto]

[prettyPhoto title="Image Gallery prettyPhoto, image 2" link="http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2012/10/entry_big_2.jpg" type="image" gallery="10" style="" class="" paragraph="false"]<img src="http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2012/10/gavatar_2.jpg" alt="" width="56" height="56" />[/prettyPhoto]

[prettyPhoto title="Image Gallery prettyPhoto, image 3" link="http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2012/10/entry_big_3.jpg" type="image" gallery="10" style="" class="" paragraph="false"]<img src="http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2012/10/gavatar_3.jpg" alt="" width="56" height="56" />[/prettyPhoto]
[/code]
<h3>YouTube and Vimeo video in Lightbox</h3>
[prettyPhoto title="" link="http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=keIGj-bTagE" type="link" gallery="" style="" class="" paragraph="false"]<img src="http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2012/10/YouTube_logo.png" alt="YouTube Video" width="60" />[/prettyPhoto]  [prettyPhoto title="" link="http://vimeo.com/20266292&amp;width=600" type="link" gallery="" style="" class="" paragraph="false"]<img src="http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2012/10/vimeo_logo.png" alt="Vimeo Video" width="60" />[/prettyPhoto]
[code]
[prettyPhoto title="" link="http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=keIGj-bTagE" type="link" gallery="" style="" class="" paragraph="false"]<img src="http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2012/10/YouTube_logo.png" alt="YouTube Video" width="60" />[/prettyPhoto]

[prettyPhoto title="" link="http://vimeo.com/20266292&amp;width=600" type="link" gallery="" style="" class="" paragraph="false"]<img src="http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2012/10/vimeo_logo.png" alt="Vimeo Video" width="60" />[/prettyPhoto]
[/code]
<h3>prettyPhoto open in iframe</h3>
[prettyPhoto title="CNN in iframe" link="http://www.cnn.com/?iframe=true&amp;width=990&amp;height=600" type="button" gallery="" style="" class="button_link btn_blue" paragraph="true"]Open CNN website in iframe[/prettyPhoto]
[code]
[prettyPhoto title="CNN in iframe" link="http://www.cnn.com/?iframe=true&amp;width=990&amp;height=600" type="button" gallery="" style="" class="button_link btn_blue" paragraph="true"]Open CNN website in iframe[/prettyPhoto]
[/code]

		<title>Shortcodes - Columns full width</title>
		<link>http://localhost/whb/?page_id=342</link>

<h2>MiniGallery in Full Width</h2>
[minigallery id="" class="" auto="0" pretty="false"]
[/raw]
[styled_box title="Styled box Title" type="box" class="box box_white"][minigallery id="" auto="3" pretty="true"][/styled_box]
[divider type="thin"]
<h1>Columns <span>inside ROW</span></h1>
[row]
[col type="1_2" class=""]
<h2>One half column</h2>
Hey there where ya goin, not exactly knowin, who says you have to call just one place home. Hes goin everywhere, B.J. McKay and his best friend Bear. He just keeps on movin, ladies keep improvin, every day is better than the last. New dreams and better scenes, and best of all I dont pay property tax.

[/col]
[col type="1_2" class=""]
<h2>One half column</h2>
Theres a voice that keeps on calling me. Down the road, thats where Ill always be. Every stop I make, I make a new friend. Cant stay for long, just turn around and Im gone again. Maybe tomorrow, Ill want to settle down, Until tomorrow, Ill just keep moving on.

[/col]
[/row]
[clear type="clear"]
[row]
[col type="1_3" class=""]
<h2>One third column</h2>
Sliders in all forms &amp; colors: Javascript, Flash, you name it! We've got it! But the best part is that they can be easily modified to fit your company's look &amp; feel.

[/col]
[col type="1_3" class=""]
<h2>One third column</h2>
These three icons below the text paragraphs are custom created for the <a href="#">Our theme</a> &amp; the included PSD files contain all the layers needed to edit them.

[/col]
[col type="1_3" class=""]
<h2>One third last</h2>
If you buy this theme we offer 24 hours response time on our dedicated support forums. That's "best in class" support offer, it just can't get better &amp; faster than this!

[/col]
[/row]
[clear type="clear"]
[row]

He just keeps on movin, ladies keep improvin, every day is better than the last. New dreams and better scenes, and best of all I dont pay property tax.

[row]
[col type="1_2"]
<h2>One half column</h2>
Hey there where ya goin, not exactly knowin, who says you have to call just one place home. Hes goin everywhere, B.J. McKay and his best friend Bear. He just keeps on movin, ladies keep improvin, every day is better than the last. New dreams and better scenes, and best of all I dont pay property tax.

[/col]
[col type="1_2"]
<h2>One half column</h2>
Theres a voice that keeps on calling me. Down the road, thats where Ill always be. Every stop I make, I make a new friend. Cant stay for long, just turn around and Im gone again. Maybe tomorrow, Ill want to settle down, Until tomorrow, Ill just keep moving on.

[/col]
[/row]
[clear]
[row]
[col type="1_3"]
<h2>1/3 column</h2>
Sliders in all forms &amp; colors: Javascript, Flash, you name it! We've got it! But the best part is that they can be easily modified to fit your company's look &amp; feel.

[/col]
[col type="1_3"]
<h2>1/3 column</h2>
These three icons below the text paragraphs are custom created for the <a href="#">HomeQuest theme</a> &amp; the included PSD files contain all the layers needed to edit them.

[/col]
[col type="1_3"]
<h2>1/3 last</h2>
If you buy this theme we offer 24 hours response time on our dedicated support forums. That's "best in class" support offer, it just can't get better &amp; faster than this!

[/col]

	<item>
		<title>Chicago SkyTower - 3 day city-break for only $599</title>
		<link>http://localhost/whb/?p=211</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 23 Apr 2012 12:26:50 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>themefuse</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://localhost/travel-agency/?p=211</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p><strong>Los Angeles Times</strong>- Kobe Bryant has received a reported $6.7-million offer from an Italian team, but it was far from certain Bryant would play there, according to a person familiar with Bryant's thought process. The lucrative offers, most of them real, keep rolling in for Kobe Bryant. He got a contract offer this week from an Italian pro team, though it was far from certain Bryant would play there, according to a person familiar with Bryant's thought process.</p>
	              <p>The new offer is for a<strong> reported $6.7 million</strong> from Italian team Virtus Bologna, which begins its season Oct. 9 and would have to come up with a huge insurance policy to land Bryant, not to mention the actual cash to get the 13-time all-star to play on the perennially underachieving team.<br>
	              Bryant, 33, is under contract with the Lakers for three more years and $83.5 million. He has several contract options from the Italian team, according to its general manager, including a shorter per-game deal that would work out to<strong> about $740,000 a game</strong>. All options are non-binding, allowing Bryant to return to the Lakers if the NBA lockout ends.</p>
	<p>Even if Bryant doesn't take the offer seriously, he continues to be a man in motion since having a non-invasive procedure on his bothersome right knee in Germany three months ago.</p>
	<p> He made promotional <u><strong>appearances</strong></u> this summer in the Philippines, China and Singapore, scored 43 points in a pro-am game in Los Angeles, played in a celebrity soccer game in Washington, talked briefly with teams in Turkey and China about playing pro basketball there, and was headed to Europe for more paid appearances next week.</p>
	              <p>The league also canceled 43 exhibition games, three of them involving the Lakers: Oct. 9 vs. Golden State in Fresno, Oct. 12 vs. Atlanta in Ontario and Oct. 15 vs. Atlanta at Staples Center.<br>
	                The Lakers were scheduled to open camp Oct. 4, with their annual media day taking place Oct. 3. Both events have been postponed indefinitely because of the lack of progress in NBA labor negotiations.</p>]]></content:encoded>

			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[a:23:{s:20:"voyage_disable_image";s:5:"false";s:20:"voyage_disable_video";s:5:"false";s:23:"voyage_disable_comments";s:5:"false";s:26:"voyage_disable_author_info";s:5:"false";s:24:"voyage_disable_post_meta";s:5:"false";s:29:"voyage_disable_published_date";s:5:"false";s:28:"voyage_disable_share_buttons";s:5:"false";s:28:"voyage_disable_after_content";s:5:"false";s:19:"voyage_single_image";s:63:"http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2012/10/entry_big_3.jpg";s:28:"voyage_single_img_dimensions";a:2:{i:0;s:3:"620";i:1;s:3:"340";}s:26:"voyage_single_img_position";s:7:"noalign";s:22:"voyage_thumbnail_image";s:59:"http://localhost/whb/wp-content/uploads/2012/10/entry_5.jpg";s:27:"voyage_thumbnail_dimensions";a:2:{i:0;s:3:"219";i:1;s:3:"156";}s:25:"voyage_thumbnail_position";s:9:"alignleft";s:17:"voyage_video_link";s:0:"";s:23:"voyage_video_dimensions";a:2:{i:0;s:3:"620";i:1;s:3:"340";}s:21:"voyage_video_position";s:9:"alignleft";s:21:"voyage_header_element";s:4:"none";s:20:"voyage_select_slider";s:2:"-1";s:29:"voyage_before_content_element";s:6:"search";s:18:"voyage_search_type";s:6:"closed";s:16:"voyage_seo_title";s:0:"";s:22:"voyage_seo_description";s:0:"";}]]></wp:meta_value>

	</item>
	<item>
		<title>Infinity Pool pass - only this weekend</title>
		<link>http://localhost/whb/?p=224</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 03 Mar 2012 12:40:22 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>themefuse</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://localhost/travel-agency/?p=217</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p><strong>Los Angeles Times</strong>- Kobe Bryant has received a reported $6.7-million offer from an Italian team, but it was far from certain Bryant would play there, according to a person familiar with Bryant's thought process. The lucrative offers, most of them real, keep rolling in for Kobe Bryant. He got a contract offer this week from an Italian pro team, though it was far from certain Bryant would play there, according to a person familiar with Bryant's thought process.</p>
	              <p>The new offer is for a<strong> reported $6.7 million</strong> from Italian team Virtus Bologna, which begins its season Oct. 9 and would have to come up with a huge insurance policy to land Bryant, not to mention the actual cash to get the 13-time all-star to play on the perennially underachieving team.<br>
	              Bryant, 33, is under contract with the Lakers for three more years and $83.5 million. He has several contract options from the Italian team, according to its general manager, including a shorter per-game deal that would work out to<strong> about $740,000 a game</strong>. All options are non-binding, allowing Bryant to return to the Lakers if the NBA lockout ends.</p>
	<p>Even if Bryant doesn't take the offer seriously, he continues to be a man in motion since having a non-invasive procedure on his bothersome right knee in Germany three months ago.</p>
	<p> He made promotional <u><strong>appearances</strong></u> this summer in the Philippines, China and Singapore, scored 43 points in a pro-am game in Los Angeles, played in a celebrity soccer game in Washington, talked briefly with teams in Turkey and China about playing pro basketball there, and was headed to Europe for more paid appearances next week.</p>
	              <p>The league also canceled 43 exhibition games, three of them involving the Lakers: Oct. 9 vs. Golden State in Fresno, Oct. 12 vs. Atlanta in Ontario and Oct. 15 vs. Atlanta at Staples Center.<br>
	                The Lakers were scheduled to open camp Oct. 4, with their annual media day taking place Oct. 3. Both events have been postponed indefinitely because of the lack of progress in NBA labor negotiations.</p>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Luxury Style: RITZ-CARLTON Shanghai, Pudong</title>
		<link>http://localhost/whb/?p=225</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 03 Mar 2012 12:48:13 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>themefuse</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://localhost/travel-agency/?p=220</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p><strong>Los Angeles Times</strong>- Kobe Bryant has received a reported $6.7-million offer from an Italian team, but it was far from certain Bryant would play there, according to a person familiar with Bryant's thought process. The lucrative offers, most of them real, keep rolling in for Kobe Bryant. He got a contract offer this week from an Italian pro team, though it was far from certain Bryant would play there, according to a person familiar with Bryant's thought process.</p>
	              <p>The new offer is for a<strong> reported $6.7 million</strong> from Italian team Virtus Bologna, which begins its season Oct. 9 and would have to come up with a huge insurance policy to land Bryant, not to mention the actual cash to get the 13-time all-star to play on the perennially underachieving team.<br>
	              Bryant, 33, is under contract with the Lakers for three more years and $83.5 million. He has several contract options from the Italian team, according to its general manager, including a shorter per-game deal that would work out to<strong> about $740,000 a game</strong>. All options are non-binding, allowing Bryant to return to the Lakers if the NBA lockout ends.</p>
	<p>Even if Bryant doesn't take the offer seriously, he continues to be a man in motion since having a non-invasive procedure on his bothersome right knee in Germany three months ago.</p>
	<p> He made promotional <u><strong>appearances</strong></u> this summer in the Philippines, China and Singapore, scored 43 points in a pro-am game in Los Angeles, played in a celebrity soccer game in Washington, talked briefly with teams in Turkey and China about playing pro basketball there, and was headed to Europe for more paid appearances next week.</p>
	              <p>The league also canceled 43 exhibition games, three of them involving the Lakers: Oct. 9 vs. Golden State in Fresno, Oct. 12 vs. Atlanta in Ontario and Oct. 15 vs. Atlanta at Staples Center.<br>
	                The Lakers were scheduled to open camp Oct. 4, with their annual media day taking place Oct. 3. Both events have been postponed indefinitely because of the lack of progress in NBA labor negotiations.</p>]]></content:encoded>
